intro: Monelasmum nutans, commonly known as the drooping monelasmum, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many species of shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its slender, branching stems and clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers. Its leaves are opposite, elliptical, and often have a slightly waxy texture. Monelasmum nutans is typically found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories.
